item.title: Snowflake JSON Capabilities
item.description: Snowflake is a relational DBMS. However, it supports querying and manipulating JSON data by providing a special data type called Variant. So, if we store the JSON documents in a single column table, Snowflake will effectively be querying JSON object. For example, consider this table defenition: CREATE TABLE JSON_DATA (DATA VARIANT); If the JSON documents are in an S3 bucket, we can import the data using a copy into command.

item.title: Automatic Data Ingestion in Snowflake Using Snowpipe
item.description: Snowflake is the new buzzword in the cloud world, which offers data-warehouse-as-a-service (probably DWAAS in the cloud lingo). If you would like to read more about its capabilities and use cases around it, take a look at their site here. FYI, they have built a new SQL Engine from scratch, and the whole platform runs on AWS infrastructure. It is a technological irony that Snowflake performs better (in my opinion) than Amazon Redshift in many ways.
